caption: This museum really deserves a visit. It was open in 2010, and it is really nice to make a visit on a sunny day, because of the light that goes through the windows. So many works you can see inside, and the ticket is not expensive 7 €. The first floor is really impressive.
This is the best experience I ever had. When your inside you just get transported into a magical place
Great little sculpture museum in a beautiful building. Free on the first Sunday of every month. Well worth a visit if you are in the area.
Beautifully organised space showcasing the sculptor's focus on face structure.
Not always open, but it's worth a visit

This museum does not have the notoriety of Parisian museums, and that's a shame! We discover the life and work of the sculptor Paul Belmondo, father of Jean-Paul. Several exhibition levels, with busts, bronzes, drawings, photos of the artist or his entourage. These are figurative, accessible works, and I find that the style conveys a certain softness, especially with regard to the busts of children or women.

Very beautiful museum. Located in an old foil chateau of Louis the XV and later the Rothschild.  Beautifully decorated with beautiful rooms and beautiful wood and copper work. Paul Belmondo was the father of the famous French actor Jean-Paul Belmondo and one of the great sculptors of France in his time.

As a real estate advisor in Boulogne Billancourt, I like to visit cult places near me and share my opinion on what I appreciated. The Paul Belmondo Museum is a true architectural gem nestled in the heart of Boulogne-Billancourt. The building, with its clean lines and its harmony between tradition and modernity, offers an ideal setting for appreciating the sculptor's works. High ceilings and large floor-to-ceiling windows allow natural light to flood the spaces, creating a calming atmosphere. A must-visit for art and architecture lovers.

Château Buchillot houses the very beautiful museum of the sculptor Paul Belmondo, whose collection of works obtained by the bequests of his children is quite impressive. Led by an excellent tour guide, we learn a lot about the artist and his sculpture. The museum's scenography is brilliant, modern, and educational for young and old. I recommend!

Museum dedicated to the work of Paul Belmondo, figurative sculptor of the 20th century. The works are well highlighted in this private mansion. We have the impression that the museum is open only for us.

Beautiful little museum, in a beautiful building dedicated to Paul Belmondo. I knew he was a sculptor and discovered that he also drew very well. We were accompanied by a charming guide, she allowed us to learn a lot about this man and his works.

I really enjoyed visiting this place and being able to appreciate the artist's beautiful sculptures as well as the drawings and medals that I didn't know! I would like to point out that all of this is presented with great taste.
It’s a small museum with few tourists and it’s quiet. You can enjoy the art.
An out-of-the-way place but still worth a visit given the quality and diversity of the pieces on display. I discovered a multi-talented artist.
nice place, I was very well received by two smiling gentlemen ;) old modernized castle rich collection of belmondo statues
The museum is housed in a very beautiful folly, magnificently highlighted by the architects to accommodate the work of Paul Belmondo.
Superb visit I loved the place

Beautiful, very rich exhibition. Beautiful presentations. Unfortunately in the beautiful plaster gallery it is not possible to read the labels because the statues are located very high and when you can see the labels they are half erased. There is something to do! Very beautiful rooms with medals and drawings and paintings. Great discovery.
